cards.name: Acetaminophen
cards.interactions: Take caution to avoid potential overdose - many OTC drugs contain acetaminophen
pearls: Either Acetaminophen or an NSAID MUST be present on a truck if an AEMT is present.

cards.name: Cefazolin
contraindications: History of allergy to any cephalosporin class antibiotics or penicillin's. No history is NOT a contraindication
cards.interactions: Take caution to avoid potential overdose - many OTC drugs contain acetaminophen
pearls: Patients with open fractures or amputations have best outcomes if receiving antibiotics within 60 minutes or less.
Agencies administering antibiotics should inquire about drug allergies specific to antibiotics or family of antibiotics.

cards.name: Haloperidol
indications: State Protocols authorize {PO} or {ODT} with BARs 5
Iredell County ONLY authorizes {IM} with BARs 6+
contraindications: Prolonged QTI (>440 ms in males, >450 ms in females)

general: May repeat every 5 minutes as needed [UP18]

pearls: Haloperidol can cause Extrapyramidal Reactions - Condition involving involuntary muscle movements or spasms typically of the face, neck and upper extremities. May present with contorted neck and trunk with difficult motor movements. Give Diphenhydramine according to protocols for allergic reaction.

1. Difficult or unable to rouse 2. Asleep but responds normally to verbal or physical contact 3. Drowsy, appears sedated 4. Quiet and awake (normal level of activity) 5. Signs of overt (physical or verbal) activity, calms down with instructions 6. Extremely or continuously active, not requiring restraint 7. Violent, requires restraint*

cards.name: Ondansetron
contraindications: Prolonged QT interval (male >440 msec, female >450 msec)
side_effects: Headache (particularly in those prone to migraine headaches)
AV conduction disturbance (associated with rapid administration)
cards.interactions: Use with caution if administering with other agents that may cause QTI prolongation
